content:
Diagnosis:	Hepatic epithelioid hemangioendothelioma, multifocal disease confined to liver

Diagnosed March 2023 following liver biopsy. Immunohistochemistry confirmed CD31 and CD34 co-expression. Initial imaging showed multiple bilobar hepatic lesions, largest measuring 3.2cm in segment 7. No extrahepatic disease identified on staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis or bone scan.

I reviewed [redacted name] today in follow-up clinic. Latest MRI liver (15/4/2024) demonstrates stable appearances of all hepatic lesions compared to previous imaging from October 2023, with no new lesions identified. The largest lesion remains unchanged at 3.2cm. Liver function tests remain normal. She continues on 3-monthly surveillance as per our unit protocol for stable hepatic epithelioid hemangioendothelioma.

On examination today, the abdomen was soft and non-tender with no hepatomegaly or other concerning features. Performance status remains 0.

The plan is to continue current surveillance approach with next MRI liver in 3 months' time. We will review her again in clinic with those results.

primary_cancer.metastases: confined to liver, no extrahepatic disease

cancer_timeline.value: Liver biopsy confirms epithelioid hemangioendothelioma with CD31/CD34 co-expression
Initial imaging shows multiple bilobar hepatic lesions, largest 3.2cm in segment 7
MRI liver shows stable disease with unchanged lesions, largest remains 3.2cm
MRI liver confirms continued stable disease with no new lesions

patient_facts.value: Abdomen soft and non-tender with no hepatomegaly

status_updates.value: Multifocal hepatic epithelioid hemangioendothelioma with stable disease on surveillance imaging
Stable disease on MRI with unchanged lesion sizes and no new lesions
Clinic review with MRI results in 3 months
